remarks: There is only one atom under both ` P .\/ Q ` and co-atom ` W ` . (Contributed by NM, 21-Nov-2012.)
statement:
lhpat.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
lhpat.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
lhpat.m $e |- ./\ = ( meet ` K ) $.
lhpat.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
lhpat.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
lhpat2.r $e |- R = ( ( P .\/ Q ) ./\ W ) $.
lhpat3 $p |- ( ( ( ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) /\ ( P e. A /\ -. P .<_ W ) ) /\ ( Q e. A /\ S e. A ) /\ ( P =/= Q /\ S .<_ ( P .\/ Q ) ) ) -> ( -. S .<_ W <-> S =/= R ) ) $.
